summary: Internal FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing efforts to locate Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails indicate the FBI was monitoring her location, had a 'silent hit' on her in TECS, and were coordinating between New York and Boston field offices, but were still weeks away from taking action.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The FBI is discussing efforts to locate and monitor her, with plans to 'grab her' when needed. She is believed to be in the Boston area.

events.title: Information received about Maxwell in Manchester-by-the-Sea
events.description: The Boston FBI office was updated about information regarding Maxwell's potential presence in Manchester-by-the-Sea, Massachusetts.

events.title: FBI coordination call on Maxwell's location
events.description: An FBI agent from New York requests a call to nail down Maxwell's location and check if she is still in the Boston area.

events.title: FBI plans 'silent hit' and monitoring of Maxwell
events.description: FBI emails indicate a 'silent hit' on Maxwell in TECS (law enforcement database) and a plan to keep an eye on her location for a future arrest, stating they are 'several weeks away from any action'.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively trying to locate Ghislaine Maxwell in August 2019, weeks before her eventual arrest.
The FBI had placed a 'silent hit' on Maxwell in TECS (a law enforcement database) to monitor her movements.
Coordination was occurring between the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force and the Boston field office regarding Maxwell's potential location.
The FBI believed Maxwell might be in the Boston area, specifically mentioned in connection with Manchester-by-the-Sea.
The emails state the FBI was 'several weeks away from any action on her', indicating her arrest was not an immediate priority at that moment.
